column4: can someone please help me out with installing ubuntu? every time i try, just before it loads the screen goes blank
then ive got no keyboard/mouse access
all i can do is reboot :(
any ideas people? muchly appreciated
assuming sufficient ram. (196m+) i'd guess you need to hit [ctrl] +[alt] +[f1]   and run sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
when it blanks out on you  ^
nice flook
tried ctrl-alt-f1, nothing happens. ive ot 768mb ram
flood
frame buffer is out of sync.   that happens    boot with  vga=normal nosplash     added to the kernel line.   that might get you as far as a console so you can reconfig the xserver
to give you a better idea of what happening: just as xserver is about to load, its as if someone has unplugged my monitor/keyb/mouse. its not that my monitor has gone black, but has no signal
yeah  try that boot line  ^   might help.
so vga=normal nosplash?
yes.    but i make no promices  that it will fix it.   it "might."
thanks for that. this is probably asking too much, but any ideas on how to reconfigure the xserver once i hit console?
the xserver on the live CD uses vesa   the splash uses frame buffering  some times the two are incompatable    if that don't help you can try the "alternate" install CD it has the textmode installer.
sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
and where can i get the 'alternate' install CD from?
that's the command you want in the console ^ ohana
from the same place you got the live.
!alternate | ohana
